Issues.Title: Fix background position value of `bg-right-top`, `bg-right-bottom`, `bg-left-bottom` and `bg-left-top`
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes the values of the `bg-right-top`, `bg-right-bottom`, `bg-left-bottom` and `bg-left-top` utilities.

In the tests they are normalized to percentage values by Lightning CSS.
<!--

👋 Hey, thanks for your interest in contributing to Tailwind!

**Please ask first before starting work on any significant new features.**

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix background position value of `bg-right-top`, `bg-right-bottom`, `bg-left-bottom` and `bg-left-top`" (#13806)

Issues.Title: Compiler Memory Leak when (repeatedly) copying files on Win x64
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
3.4.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
`npx tailwindcss -i` directly via `npm run tailwind`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v20.14.0 x64

**What browser are you using?**
N/A 

**What operating system are you using?**
Windows 11 x64 (Fresh Development Image)

**Issue Description**

During development the Tailwind compiler was crashing about every 15min for a specific Visual studio project. The reproduction is based on some of the files from that development project (only CSHTML files). 

When these files are copied (repeatedly) into a directory Tailwind is watching, it causes the node process memory allocation to increase until a out of memory exception occurs.

The reproduction below has worked multiple times without fail with somewhere between 2-5 iterations of copying and then removing the files.

**Reproduction**

Reproduction is on a fresh Windows 11 Development VM (the one available on any Windows Machine with Hyper-V) with no additional software except Node + NPM to rule out any side effects from my own dev system.

- Hyper-V Windows > Create New VM > Windows 11 Development
- Install Node v20.14.0 x64 and NPM
- Copy Files as-is to C:\Test
- Run "npm install"
- Run "npm run tailwind"

Observe memory allocation for node process while repeating these steps:
- Copy all files from "C:\Test\TailwindMemoryIssue\ProblemFiles" to "C:\Test\TailwindMemoryIssue\Pages\InsertProblemFilesHereWhenTailwindIsRunning"
- Delete all files from "C:\Test\TailwindMemoryIssue\Pages\InsertProblemFilesHereWhenTailwindIsRunning"
- And repeat this (for me runaway memory leak usually happens after 3rd time)

**Video of Reproduction**

- https://www.loom.com/share/6f6a4dcd97cc49cead58927332c1f1b2

**Project Files (Zip)**

- without node_modules (requires npm install):
https://e.pcloud.link/publink/show?code=XZo1zTZofpxPU6vCMBNLhROcTm7Nups8HWk

- with node_modules (in case that's relevant): https://e.pcloud.link/publink/show?code=XZvDzTZnkOH1ghBP7H2nfULSqwdJQyYAw37

VM is available on request too (~30GB Hyper-V Image)

**Console Output for Error**
```
<--- Last few GCs --->

[3060:0000025BF067BE40]    93645 ms: Mark-Compact (reduce) 2045.5 (2083.7) -> 2044.7 (2083.9) MB, 1876.40 / 0.00 ms  (average mu = 0.122, current mu = 0.005) allocation failure; scavenge might not succeed
[3060:0000025BF067BE40]    95472 ms: Mark-Compact (reduce) 2045.7 (2083.9) -> 2045.0 (2084.2) MB, 1822.47 / 0.00 ms  (average mu = 0.067, current mu = 0.003) allocation failure; scavenge might not succeed


<--- JS stacktrace --->

FATAL ERROR: Reached heap limit Allocation failed - JavaScript heap out of memory
----- Native stack trace -----

 1: 00007FF77D796CEB node::SetCppgcReference+18123
 2: 00007FF77D708A74 v8::base::CPU::num_virtual_address_bits+90708
 3: 00007FF77E180101 v8::Isolate::ReportExternalAllocationLimitReached+65
 4: 00007FF77E169858 v8::Function::Experimental_IsNopFunction+1336
 5: 00007FF77DFCB2A0 v8::Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis+659328
 6: 00007FF77DFC8328 v8::Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis+647176
 7: 00007FF77DFDD63A v8::Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis+733978
 8: 00007FF77DFDDEB7 v8::Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis+736151
 9: 00007FF77DFE6AEE v8::Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis+772046
10: 00007FF77DFF7436 v8::Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis+839958
11: 00007FF77DFFC008 v8::Platform::SystemClockTimeMillis+859368
12: 00007FF77DD7313A v8::base::Thread::StartSynchronously+372186
13: 00007FF77DC908D5 v8::CodeEvent::GetFunctionName+2549
14: 00007FF71E1DAAFA
```

**Misc references**
- Original Gist: https://gist.github.com/aduggleby/909eee25dc8aef66a3bf15e647426aa3
- Original Tweet: https://x.com/alexduggleby/status/1798260194255794686
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Compiler Memory Leak when (repeatedly) copying files on Win x64" (#13794)

Issues.Title: error in an import (flattenColorPalette)
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
v3.4.1
For example: v2.0.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**
nextjs
For example: postcss-cli 8.3.1, Next.js 10.0.9, webpack 5.28.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**
v20.12.0
For example: v12.0.0

**What browser are you using?**
arc browser
For example: Chrome, Safari, or N/A

**What operating system are you using?**
windows 11
For example: macOS, Windows

**Reproduction URL**

A Tailwind Play link or public GitHub repo that includes a minimal reproduction of the bug. **Please do not link to your actual project**, what we need instead is a _minimal_ reproduction in a fresh project without any unnecessary code. This means it doesn't matter if your real project is private/confidential, since we want a link to a separate, isolated reproduction anyways.

A reproduction is **required** when filing an issue — any issue opened without a reproduction will be closed and you'll be asked to create a new issue that includes a reproduction. We're a small team and we can't keep up with the volume of issues we receive if we need to reproduce each issue from scratch ourselves.

**Describe your issue**
Could not find a declaration file for module 'tailwindcss/lib/util/flattenColorPalette'. 'c:/Users/joaop/OneDrive/Documentos/listen_services/node_modules/tailwindcss/lib/util/flattenColorPalette.js' implicitly has an 'any' type.
  If the 'tailwindcss' package actually exposes this module, try adding a new declaration (.d.ts) file containing `declare module 'tailwindcss/lib/util/flattenColorPalette';`ts(7016)
Describe the problem you're seeing, any important steps to reproduce and what behavior you expect instead.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "error in an import (flattenColorPalette)" (#13791)

Issues.Title: Classes generation error using symlink
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**
(next-cli)
```
dependencies:
next 14.2.3
react 18.3.1
react-dom 18.3.1

devDependencies:
@types/node 20.12.12
@types/react 18.3.2
@types/react-dom 18.3.0
postcss 8.4.38
tailwindcss 3.4.3
typescript 5.4.5       
```

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

NextJS

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.11.1

**What browser are you using?**

Firefox tested, also chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

MacOS

**Reproduction URL**

https://github.com/ScreamZ/bug-tw

**Describe your issue**

For a project, I've been in the need of duplicating pages in two separated folders. Therefore tailwind is silently not generating classes (after restart of the dev server).

Then when starting the server it generate classes that it found, but once the page is rendered, it's not able to generate new classes (that doesn't already exists in the generated file).

If you remove the symlink it works again after restart.

Repro instruction in readme of repo

Thanks
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Classes generation error using symlink" (#13731)

Issues.Title: [v3] Support negative values for `{col,row}-{start,end}` utilities
Issues.Body: Fixes #13754
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[v3] Support negative values for `{col,row}-{start,end}` utilities" (#13781)

Issues.Title: Col-end does not support negative values
Issues.Body:
This is a very small issue, col-end does not support negative values out of the box, but negative values makes a lot of sense there. This happens on **v3.4.3**. https://play.tailwindcss.com/8L8o0VhDfr The code is here: ~~~ html
BROKEN
WORKS
~~~ I'm not sure if this is exactly a bug, because it is not explicitly described in the documentation, but it is a broken expectation (I've expected that to work for consistency).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Col-end does not support negative values" (#13754)

Issues.Title: [v4] Support negative values for `{col,row}-{start,end}` utilities
Issues.Body:
Fixes #13754

Not including support for this seems to have been an oversight. We'll be backporting this to v3 as well.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "[v4] Support negative values for `{col,row}-{start,end}` utilities" (#13780)

Issues.Title: Class detection in Ruby Template files
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

`v3.3.3`

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Using `vite` with `v4.4.12`

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

`v21.5.0`

**Reproduction URL**

`n/a` – I can add a repo later for debugging help.

**Describe your issue**

We are using [ViewComponent](https://github.com/ViewComponent/view_component) to manage our HTML templates.

With a ruby template like this:

```rb
class FooComponent < ApplicationComponent
  def call = tag.span "Foo", class: %w[rounded-full h-0.5 w-0.5]
end
```

The generated Tailwind styles then doesn't include the `w-0.75`-class.

When re-arranging the css classes like so:

```rb
class FooComponent < ApplicationComponent
  def call = tag.span "Foo", class: %w[rounded-full w-0.5 h-0.5]
end
```

The generated Tailwind styles then doesn't include the `h-0.75`-class instead.

When re-arranging the css classes like so:

```rb
class FooComponent < ApplicationComponent
  def call = tag.span "Foo", class: %w[w-0.5 h-0.5 rounded-full]
end
``

The css classes `h-0.75` and `w-0.75` are included/available.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Class detection in Ruby Template files" (#13778)

Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

4.0 alpha

For example: v2.0.4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

      "dependencies": {

Issues.Title: Fix multiple <alpha-value> in color definitions
Issues.Body:
Fixes #13716 by using `.replaceAll('<alpha-value>'` instead of `.replace('<alpha-value>'`.

I wasn't sure how many tests to add (i.e. I didn't add tests for the opacity classes or `theme()` function), so I could add more if needed 🙂
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix multiple <alpha-value> in color definitions" (#13740)

Issues.Title: For example: min-[1620px] is not workin, tailwind dont see this, but media xl, 2xl, md he is see)) (sorry for my english)
Issues.Body:
I used ti CDN 3.4.3 and use this class:

 <div class="
                    map-grayscale 
                    relative                                            xl:absolute 
                                                lg:translate-y-[-100px] xl:translate-y-0
                    left-0      md:left-[10%]   lg:left-[50%]                               2xl:left-[30%]  min-[1620px]:left-[20%]
                    top-0                                               xl:-top-1/4 
                    w-full      md:w-[80%]      lg:w-1/2                xl:w-2/3                            min-[1620px]:w-full
                                                lg:z-20                 xl:z-10
                    shadow-2xl
                    mb-16
">

TailWind dont see min-[1620px]:left-[20%] & min-[1620px]:w-full ((((((

Issues.Title: Create plugin: addBase does not work inside of matchComponents
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

3.4.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Postcss 8.4.38 in Next.js 14.1.0

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v20.5.0

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

[Codesandbox.io](https://codesandbox.io/p/devbox/funny-hoover-forked-hcg5m6?layout=%257B%2522sidebarPanel%2522%253A%2522EXPLORER%2522%252C%2522rootPanelGroup%2522%253A%257B%2522direction%2522%253A%2522horizontal%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522UNKNOWN%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL_GROUP%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522ROOT_LAYOUT%2522%252C%2522panels%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL_GROUP%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522UNKNOWN%2522%252C%2522direction%2522%253A%2522vertical%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800063b6odgnlkrh4%2522%252C%2522sizes%2522%253A%255B57.38379814077025%252C42.61620185922975%255D%252C%2522panels%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL_GROUP%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522EDITOR%2522%252C%2522direction%2522%253A%2522horizontal%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522EDITOR%2522%252C%2522panels%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522EDITOR%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800023b6o5beisu67%2522%257D%255D%257D%252C%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL_GROUP%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522SHELLS%2522%252C%2522direction%2522%253A%2522horizontal%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522SHELLS%2522%252C%2522panels%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522SHELLS%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800043b6o7exkrhl1%2522%257D%255D%252C%2522sizes%2522%253A%255B100%255D%257D%255D%257D%252C%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL_GROUP%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522DEVTOOLS%2522%252C%2522direction%2522%253A%2522vertical%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522DEVTOOLS%2522%252C%2522panels%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522PANEL%2522%252C%2522contentType%2522%253A%2522DEVTOOLS%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800053b6o40v0agjl%2522%257D%255D%252C%2522sizes%2522%253A%255B100%255D%257D%255D%252C%2522sizes%2522%253A%255B50%252C50%255D%257D%252C%2522tabbedPanels%2522%253A%257B%2522clwomhmg800023b6o5beisu67%2522%253A%257B%2522tabs%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800013b6oyuqf55q5%2522%252C%2522mode%2522%253A%2522permanent%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A%2522FILE%2522%252C%2522filepath%2522%253A%2522%252Fpackage.json%2522%252C%2522state%2522%253A%2522IDLE%2522%257D%255D%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800023b6o5beisu67%2522%252C%2522activeTabId%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800013b6oyuqf55q5%2522%257D%252C%2522clwomhmg800053b6o40v0agjl%2522%253A%257B%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800053b6o40v0agjl%2522%252C%2522activeTabId%2522%253A%2522clwomty2c01373b6oq6yfjrcm%2522%252C%2522tabs%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522UNASSIGNED_PORT%2522%252C%2522port%2522%253A3000%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomty2c01373b6oq6yfjrcm%2522%252C%2522mode%2522%253A%2522permanent%2522%252C%2522path%2522%253A%2522%252F%2522%257D%255D%257D%252C%2522clwomhmg800043b6o7exkrhl1%2522%253A%257B%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800043b6o7exkrhl1%2522%252C%2522tabs%2522%253A%255B%257B%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomhmg800033b6oml6azzfy%2522%252C%2522mode%2522%253A%2522permanent%2522%252C%2522type%2522%253A%2522TERMINAL%2522%252C%2522shellId%2522%253A%2522clwomhmur000hd9f8fshg248m%2522%257D%252C%257B%2522type%2522%253A%2522TASK_LOG%2522%252C%2522taskId%2522%253A%2522Development%2522%252C%2522id%2522%253A%2522clwomtsn7010x3b6ouzod8kwk%2522%252C%2522mode%2522%253A%2522permanent%2522%257D%255D%252C%2522activeTabId%2522%253A%2522clwomtsn7010x3b6ouzod8kwk%2522%257D%257D%252C%2522showDevtools%2522%253Atrue%252C%2522showShells%2522%253Atrue%252C%2522showSidebar%2522%253Atrue%252C%2522sidebarPanelSize%2522%253A15%257D)


**Describe your issue**

As you can see, classes `typo-headline` and `typo-body` get rendered, but `size-small`
 does not.
 
 The nested pattern of plugin methods does not seem to work. But I would expect `addBase` to create a `size-small` class.
 
 ```
matchComponents(
        {
          typo: (value) => {
            console.log("🔴", value);

            addBase({
              ".size-small": {
                [`--typo-${value}-fz`]: "1.5rem",
              },
            });

            return [
              {
                fontSize: `var(--typo-${value}-fz)`,
              },
            ];
          },
        },
        {
          values: {
            display: "display",
            headline: "headline",
            body: "body",
          },
        },
      );
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Create plugin: addBase does not work inside of matchComponents" (#13748)

Issues.Title: Bump dependencies
Issues.Body:
This PR bumps all the dependencies to the latest version.

Also updated the tests to reflect the Lightning CSS ordering change that we saw in the previous PR.

It's never a fun experience to have your pull request declined after investing a lot of time and effort into a new feature. To avoid this from happening, we request that contributors create an issue to first discuss any significant new features. This includes things like adding new utilities, creating new at-rules, or adding new component examples to the documentation.

https://github.com/tailwindcss/tailwindcss/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md

-->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Bump dependencies" (#13741)

Issues.Title: `dark:` does not work with `@apply` in v3.4.3
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?** v3.4.3 **What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?** Any, see play link below (testing locally with next ^13.4.8) **What version of Node.js are you using?** Any, see play link below (testing locally with v20) **What browser are you using?** N/A **What operating system are you using?** For example: macOS, Windows **Reproduction URL** https://play.tailwindcss.com/B3rXO1s8k1 **Describe your issue** Using `dark:*` with `@apply` does not work (for any of the dark mode strategies), see reproduction or copy the code below. For the css, applying it to a specific layer does not work either (i.e. `@layer base { body { @apply ... } }`). Config: ```ts // tailwind.config.js /** @type {import('tailwindcss').Config} */ export default { darkMode: [ 'variant', [ '@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark) { &:not([data-mode="light"] *) }', '&:is([data-mode="dark"] *)', ], ], // Just to be sure, these do not work with @apply either // darkMode: ['selector', '[data-mode="dark"]'], // darkMode: 'media', } ``` CSS: ```css @tailwind base; @tailwind components; @tailwind utilities; body { @apply text-blue-600 dark:text-red-500; } ``` HTML: ```html

Light + dark mode with @apply via CSS (does not work):

Hello Tailwind!

^ Above should be blue

Hello Tailwind!

^ Above should be red

Light + dark mode via classes in the HTML (works!):

Hello Tailwind!

^ Above should be blue

Hello Tailwind!

^ Above should be red

``` I expect both `@apply` and inline classes to yield the result of the bottom part of this image: ![image](https://github.com/tailwindlabs/tailwindcss/assets/15910702/08035462-29b5-451f-a130-0c59181f8a20)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`dark:` does not work with `@apply` in v3.4.3" (#13739)

Issues.Title: fixed bg-clip-text invalid property value error in Brave Version 1.29.80 (Chromium: 93.0.4577.63)
Issues.Body:
`bg-clip-text`, which translates to `background-clip: text` does not work on the latest Brave version (1.29.80).

It says: "Invalid property value".

By simply adding the -webkit-background-clip counterpart  similarly to other classes (e.g., box-decoration), it works like a charm !

Cheers
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fixed bg-clip-text invalid property value error in Brave Version 1.29.80 (Chromium: 93.0.4577.63)" (#13736)

Issues.Title: [v3] Double quotes break arbitrary variants
Issues.Body:
**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

v3.4.3

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

Just using Tailwind CLI

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

v18.17.1

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Reproduction URL**

[Link to Tailwind Play](https://play.tailwindcss.com/QvJPIRVnqD)

**Describe your issue**

I found that while trying to use an arbitrary selector (to choose a child by role attribute) you **must** use single quotes. Double quotes break the selector.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[v3] Double quotes break arbitrary variants" (#13737)

Issues.Title: v4: tailwind.default is not a function when running with Angular 17 and esbuild
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please provide all of the information requested below. We're a small team and without all of this information it's not possible for us to help and your bug report will be closed. -->

**What version of Tailwind CSS are you using?**

4

**What build tool (or framework if it abstracts the build tool) are you using?**

- nx 19
- angular-cli 17

**What version of Node.js are you using?**

18.20.2

**What browser are you using?**

Chrome

**What operating system are you using?**

macOS

**Describe your issue**

Installed TW 4 and added `@import 'tailwindcss` and getting the following error when running `nx serve app`:

```sh
✘ [ERROR] tailwind.default is not a function [plugin angular-sass]

    node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/tools/esbuild/stylesheets/stylesheet-plugin-factory.js:112:74:
      112 │ ...s.postcssProcessor = postcss().use(tailwind.default({ config }));
          ╵                                                       ^

    at setupPostcss (/Users/alexciesielski/Documents/basement/test-app/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/tools/esbuild/stylesheets/stylesheet-plugin-factory.js:112:75)
    at async setup (/Users/alexciesielski/Documents/basement/test-app/node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/tools/esbuild/stylesheets/stylesheet-plugin-factory.js:122:42)
    at async handlePlugins (/Users/alexciesielski/Documents/basement/test-app/node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:1340:9)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "v4: tailwind.default is not a function when running with Angular 17 and esbuild" (#13725)
